docs.lead_paragraph: Some 10,000 to 17,500 poor children younger than school age in Massachusetts may be chronically malnourished, according to a health study made public Monday. The State Department of Public Health's 1983 Massachusetts Nutrition Survey represents a study of 1,429 low-income children aged 6 months to 6 years.
